website_summaries.verdict: Imported, handmade oil paints from Italy. Top-of-the-line set with vibrant hues. Great for experienced artists.
pros: Tubes are filled with lustrous paints with lovely pigments
Concentrated color and texture without an oily consistency
Set of 10 comes in a nice case
Many other color option sets available
cons: Paints might be too gritty for some users, so you may want to mix in a thinning medium

customer_reviews.title: The Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: I have been an oil painter for about 10 years now and of all the brands of paints I have ever used, Williambsurg Oils are the absolute best. Pigment is out of this world and the price could definitely be worse for what you are getting. I paint super thin so a tube will last me forever, and the color sets with the smaller sized tubes work best for me to be able to try new colors without committing to fun sized tubes. The signature color set is beautiful and I would recommend giving ANY Williamsburg colors a try.
customer_reviews.author: Ajh

customer_reviews.title: Best burnt umber I’ve used.
customer_reviews.text: While I’ve read that some signature colors may have a slightly gritty texture, I can say that this burnt (and even brown) umber is probably the best umber paint I’ve ever used. It holds its own against Michael Harding’s earth tones and is miles ahead of Winsor & Newton and Gamblin. It’s creamier and doesn’t come out of the tube like 10 year old toothpaste. It mixes splendidly with extenders.
customer_reviews.author: Dapper Doppleganger

customer_reviews.title: These paints are NOT high quality/ pure pigment. Color fades over time.
customer_reviews.text: After using W paints for many years ( I bought into the hype, foolish me) i would notice grittiness in many colors and a fading over time. Golden paints bought Williamsburg :( and while they brag about their high pigment quantity the proof is in the pudding and their colors absolutely fade. I suspect fillers in these paints. Not immediately but over time. Want to feel disappointed and cheated when you see your painting looking dull? Then go ahead and use these. Pure pigments mixed with linseed oil with no fillers will stay vibrant and will never fade. Now that I make my own oil paints, I clearly see the difference. I don't recommend these to any working/ professional painter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing what a few touches can make when playing with ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Williamsburg paints for years and just started to use iridescent. It's amazing what a few touches can make when playing with light in a landscape. I highly recommend these paints.
customer_reviews.author: J Weckbacher

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful paints
customer_reviews.text: I had been using another well known, available everywhere paint, but never felt it could be applied smoothly. I decided to try Williamsburg and I must say I’m delighted. It is so much smoother than the G brand, the colors are gorgeous and I hope to expand my selection soon.
customer_reviews.author: MountainMama

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: This line is a buttery easy to use oil but frankly the colors all look alike to me and I thought I had a strong eye for delicate differences in tone and the value of the oil. I'm not going to return them because in my effort to find happiness in the colors I used too much of the product and it would be shameful to return them used. I would not reorder this particular color set again but if the other color options suit I might try them. Its lovley oil paint but the colors are too damn similar.
customer_reviews.author: MW80

customer_reviews.title: Great for adding a touch for gold and shine to any artwork
customer_reviews.text: As a professional artist, I love this paint for adding a golden shine to my artwork. You’ll need a several coats for the gold to be truly opaque or to have a base cost and the gold over top of it (as seen in my attached artwork). Otherwise one coat acts as a glistening sheen in the sunlight. It’s expensive, but just a touch of gold in any artwork makes all the difference. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: @jade.isms

customer_reviews.title: I really love this color
customer_reviews.text: I really love this color; it's probably grittier than I'd typically like, but it's been fun painting with Williamsburg's various grays. I like this one a lot and I keep adding it here and there (more than I thought I would).
customer_reviews.author: J. Eaton

customer_reviews.title: great gift. Great paints, Great service
customer_reviews.text: Williamsburg is always a fine paint to use. I got this nice set to give as a Xmas gift. It arrived quickly, well-packed, a pretty little box. Will make a wonderful gift. I use Williamsburg paints myself and love them. I recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Vendor!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing paint and wonderful vendor! This vendor is a family owned art supplies store. They were incredibly professional and amazing customer service with a small snafu that I had. I would absolutely order from this vendor again! Thanks for everything!
customer_reviews.author: G. Dukeman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Beautiful set of paints, after using lots of oil paints that was only available to where I live, It took me a long time to realize that maybe not all oil paints worked like this (hi i'm stupid) upgrading to williamsburg was like seeing the sky for the first time. They're bright, colorful and flows nicely. Cons: Expensive AF, but these paints made me love painting again so I think its worth the cost, unless another brand that's cheaper but equal or better in quality shows up lol
customer_reviews.author: Joey Y. Veloso

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous color
customer_reviews.text: These colors are gorgeous. As soon as they arrived, I added two shades of ochre and some black to an etching i had done of the dog. I can’t wait to actually paint on canvas with them. The viscosity is perfect and the hues are so rich.
customer_reviews.author: Kaysi12

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: This product is very high quality and I us it mixed with Naples Yellow to make a special paint for a project that has been decades in the making.
customer_reviews.author: Don Dernbach

customer_reviews.title: Needless to say she was very pleased with the colors of these paints
customer_reviews.text: Brought this for my daughter, she was taking a oil painting class. The colors pigments were very strong and mix very well. Needless to say she was very pleased with the colors of these paints.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Barber

customer_reviews.title: Very small bottles, good to color test
customer_reviews.text: The smaller colors are very itty bitty tiny bottles, but I wasn't sure if the shades provided were what I needed for a project, so they were good to 'sample' the colors.
customer_reviews.author: Cally Kari Shokka

customer_reviews.title: not metallic at all
customer_reviews.text: it is not metallic. If you need a metallic gold do not order this. It's very flat gold. not attractive at all
customer_reviews.author: Tan shir

customer_reviews.title: One of the best oil paint brands I've used.
customer_reviews.text: Great consistency, pigmentation, and flow. All around a great product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: KOVAL

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I can only use it if blended with 50% ...
customer_reviews.text: The color is exactly what I was looking for ... a glittery silver. The texture, however, was unexpected. I was hoping for a more fluid buttery texture. I feel like I can only use it if blended with 50% Solvent-free gel painting medium.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Essential for oil painting.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality paint with a transparent property. As I do portraits, I will always have this product in stock.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Oil Paints
customer_reviews.text: Recently started using this brand and falling in love with the way it goes on the canvas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A palette essential!!
customer_reviews.text: The Williamsburg Raw Umber is one of my favorite colors. It's a cool neutral. Many brands have a raw umber that is close to a dark sienna; however, this paint practically dances with other colors--especially blues. I highly recommended it!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron T. Kayes

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice & buttery paint with great coverage
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice & buttery paint with great coverage. I typically mix all my colors, but this was a fun addition to my palette for anything kind of pinkish brownish.
customer_reviews.author: J. Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Legit pigments!
customer_reviews.text: My first time using this line of paint and it is wonderfully pigmented and consistent!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Putnam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect for what I was painting. The texture and color were superb.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: X
customer_reviews.text: mixes well with mediums and keeps coverage. Very smooth paints.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Garcia

customer_reviews.title: A+++++
customer_reviews.text: Williamsburg is good full bodied paint, it's my go to paint when I can't find or afford Old Holland, but is not as stiff as OH, The color was right on, though. have to be careful of that now.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Deep hues and bright brights
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful colors, vivid and wonderful to work with. The oils work well with texturized paintings as well as traditional painting styles.
customer_reviews.author: T F L

customer_reviews.title: Hard to work with
customer_reviews.text: It’s extremely hard to work with this, however; if you apply it by itself and with no oil or other paint, it will work fine
customer_reviews.author: Belen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful flesh tone
customer_reviews.text: I love this color. It is a wonderful flesh tone to use in portraits or landscapes. It is rather pricey, but goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Art Queen

customer_reviews.title: That i would buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: I like how soft and manageable it was. It cover the canvas really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Colette Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality oil paint....This particular color of white is hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL B. MILLER

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect golden color that I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect golden color that I was looking for. I used it to paint a ceramic octopus and it looks beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Mansi

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Cobalt Violet
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite oil to paint with. Hand mixed- beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: T F L

customer_reviews.title: From Gamblin to Williamsburg
customer_reviews.text: I've been slowly upgrading my oils from Gamblin to Williamsburg, and I have to say that Williamsburg creates a beautiful product. I am mostly a plein air painter. Using Williamsburg helps me make bolder choices with my color. I wish they had student grade paints. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: maria tuttle

customer_reviews.title: Much slower drying than other oils
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has terrible coverage and neverrrrrrr dries. Which means it needs 3 coats to look decent and it will take you basically 5 lifetimes to wait for each coat to dry. I won’t use it again, what a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett Blaess

customer_reviews.title: Just ok...not the usual quality of williamsburg
customer_reviews.text: As Williamsburg paints go are the least favorite I have ever had but typically most metallic or iridescent oil paints are not the best quality to begin with. The photo that is shown when you click on it on Amazon does not show the colors of paints that you are actually getting. The silver and I think it's a pewter color are actually almost the same shade. But by comparison to other brands of metallic or iridescent oil paints it's still better than any others I have found
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Dry & Clumpy
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a bad tube, not sure but the paint was so dry and clumpy I couldn't use it. I'm not too familiar with this kind of paint so I thought I would try to mix it up in the tube, nothing worked. I managed to get some paint on the brush but it was so dry, it would stick on the canvas.
customer_reviews.author: KadyQ

customer_reviews.title: Good luster
customer_reviews.text: Color and luster very good. Paint workability left a little to be desired. Would have liked it to be creamier for application
customer_reviews.author: ahg

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, Silky, Pleasure to Use
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality oil paint. The color is gorgeous, and incredible when mixed with other colors (I use it for blue skintones.) Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: L.A. Burt

customer_reviews.title: The best oils I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: Best butter oil paints! Highly recommend! These are worth paying for the smooth texture and mixture of pigment and binder leads to easier painting that is smooth and vibrant! My favorite paints!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Dries fast
customer_reviews.text: It’s truly metallic Gold but the consistency is unpredictable when it comes out the tube each time it’s used. Sometimes runny mostly oil. Other times it’s super thick in need of oil. It reminds me of the Philadelphia cream cheese spread consistency and when I try to make it smoother, it doesn’t let me.
customer_reviews.author: Eric34chris

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great paint and just what I expected! There is a sort of chalky quality about this white that I find very appealing. Quality paint.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Paint
customer_reviews.text: I am sure the paint is good. But the tubes are very small.
customer_reviews.author: kbrady

customer_reviews.title: Superior product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, high pigment load, top notch, high quality oil paint.
customer_reviews.author: Gil

customer_reviews.title: Great gold
customer_reviews.text: This came quickly, on time, and is a great product. Especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Marburks

customer_reviews.title: Looks great as a final highlight on water to make it ...
customer_reviews.text: This paint is gorgeous!!! Looks great as a final highlight on water to make it really sparkle! You need very little of this so don't waste!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: amazing paint
customer_reviews.text: the set arrived on time and I was taken away by the quality of the paint its not to soft or to hard is has just a perfect consistency I think I found myself a new brand of oil paint to use.
customer_reviews.author: Herfros

customer_reviews.title: I use it for my flesh tones in painting portraits ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my flesh tones in painting portraits. It gives a deep umber when mixed with ivory black.
customer_reviews.author: Martoni48

customer_reviews.title: love this color its pale enough to not be overwhelming
customer_reviews.text: Just the hint of warmth that gives it life. love this color its pale enough to not be overwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: Old Boots

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong with Williamsburg oils.
customer_reviews.text: Great paint. Heavy pigment load and smooth. The color is on the cooler side and it’s perfect for a rich red brown I like for painting my horses.
customer_reviews.author: Myla

customer_reviews.title: I’m in awe of how wonderful this paint is
customer_reviews.text: Lovely paint! Smoothe and very luxurious! I’m in awe of how wonderful this paint is!!
customer_reviews.author: dakco

customer_reviews.title: Good quality pigment!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality of paint, am an artist, used for painting on canvas panels!
customer_reviews.author: Jean Ranstrom

customer_reviews.title: Good, nice and perfect for mixing
customer_reviews.text: Really nice titanium white. Perfect for mixing and an absolute must for all oil paints. Williamsburg Titanium White had very little oil separation and worked great. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Batty TN

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This paint is perfect! It lasted me through my painting class. :)
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Arrived leaked
customer_reviews.text: I was super looking forward to this arriving but it arrived punctured and leaking. Super dissapointing.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra McGlothin

customer_reviews.title: I love, love, love Williamsburg oil paints!
customer_reviews.text: Williamsburg oil paints in general have the most amazing, full bodied texture! Not overly creamy like other brands which is an issue if you paint with mediums. And the hue of this umber has the most beautiful greenish cast to it. A nice addition to your palette. I use it often in my copies at the National Gallery of Art in Washington DC and in my own studio work. www.lagoarthurstudio.com
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Lago Arthur

customer_reviews.title: The Best Paints in the World!
customer_reviews.text: I love the vibrant colors of Williamsburg paints. They are really a jewel in artists bag of paints. A little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Anne

customer_reviews.title: ... grainy and takes forever to dry but I still love it.
customer_reviews.text: A bit grainy and takes forever to dry but I still love it.
customer_reviews.author: susan s.

customer_reviews.title: something ahout the paint
customer_reviews.text: color great all pigment no fillers good coverage mixes well with all paints ,this is something ill buy again and again...
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: 8/10 buttery not runny
customer_reviews.text: 8/10 top quality paint up there with blockx old holland
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: Love the orange hue of this Ocher!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing color. Am using it in everything now from portraits to landscapes. You will love it! And the quality is unsurpassed because it is Williamsburg. www.lagoarthurstudio.com
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Lago Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't even opened the box yet but it's a 5
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

Each pigment or color is treated differently to bring out its unique property
